intro: Syzygium puberulum, commonly known as the rough apple tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, rough-textured leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Syzygium puberulum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in Australian flora.
